i still dont like how fast ziggs can destroy turrets.
I mean sure, but turrets die in seconds anyways... I mean at 10 minutes, leaving your lane while an enemy is in it is basically like saying "please take my turret" unless you have TP.
but ziggs can do it a lot faster than anyone else because of his good waveclear, passive and w.

Well debatable, but it also requires a large amount of his Mana to do it, plus he loses his only forms of CC and poke in order to clear waves then take the turret. Even so Ziggs pays for this turret taking ability by being squishy and entirely skillshot oriented, plus like I said it costs him mana and cool downs to do it.
after he gets last chapter he can poke the opponent out of lane (or even auto them with passive), then take the turret while they're gone.

I feel like its easier to bully a Ziggs out of lane than for him to bully you out of lane. He has high mana costs and all you need to do is dodge his Q. He is squishy and has only 1 form of escape which is on a really long cool down. I have never seen a Ziggs who was a legit threat in laning phase, he is very easy to gank and if he is pushing you out of lane and taking your turret it means your jungler is not ganking properly.
if ziggs is easy to gank then he's not using his long range properly.

No I meant if he is taking your turret he is going to be easy to gank. Let him push you behind your turret and just call for Jungler ganks. Even if you don't kill him, getting some time to farm can help you stay in the game.

**Best:** {{champion:432}} {{champion:202}} {{champion:240}} Clear weaknesses. Very thematic. Clean, not overloaded, and windows of opportunity for both sides. 

Worst: {{champion:254}} Has waveclear, her shield, can be tanky while melting carries, is mobile af, and is almost impossible to build against with her %hp damage and armor shred. Additionally, there is no counter play to her ultimate, which makes me biased against her 24/7. She has cool skins though. 

{{champion:245}} Too much is going on. When fighting Ekko, you gotta manage his passive stacks, your mana, your cooldowns, his mana, his cooldowns, his W stun, ganks, cs, his Q on _both directions_, and his ultimate. Even out of laning phase, you gotta kite him, watch his passive stacks, stay away from his Q, stay away from his W, and stay away from his ult while he runs in circles around you like Speed Gonzales. 

{{champion:84}} Snowbally and sheet.

Vi was actually in a really balanced spot before the jungle changes & addition of courage of the colossus pushed her to FOTM status. 

The counterplay to her ultimate, later in the game at least, is positioning. If she ults you while you're behind your frontline as you should be in teamfights if you are playing someone who will be a priority target, she'll simply get locked down and killed.
she suffers a bit the "damage or tankiness?" dilemma but i'd say she's the 3rd or 4th jungler in the game considering her overall strenghts

How is Kled bad? Even though he's strong and can snowball, he doesn't really statcheck you as hard as other toplaners. People say things like Xin and J4 are alright but Xin is a walking ball of stats and J4's power is literally all locked into his burst without anything else. You survive it, you win.

Kled has to commit to killing you if he wants to fight like J4, but it's not over if you survive right away. Of course, since he has high DPS with upfront burst, he can overwhelm you, but you have time to fight opposed to R-E-Q-AA-death.

Kled's strentghs and weaknesses are really clear. He has no AoE damage, he has pretty terrible disengage, no hard CC except displacements which are primarily good for stopping channels, and his damage is delayed. His 4th W, his Q second proc, his E reactivate, and his ult's travel time all help delay his damage.

His strengths however are that he can 1v1 pretty dang well, he has absurd engage, and if he plans well can remount for a large heal.
not to mention potentially the best all-in in the game

{{champion:236}} is an example of a very good designed champion

clear strengths and weaknesses, doesn't feel clunky, is fun to play with and not frustrating to play against.

2016 had {{champion:202}} and {{champion:163}} as good designed champions.

but i'm asking myself what they think when they release shit like {{champion:240}} or {{champion:164}}.
i mean, do they really think that such BS is a good addidion to the game?

Lucian's only real weakness is his lack of hard CC, which tons of ADC's have along with their own weaknesses. His less then average range isn't a big deal with his Q, ult, and E allowing him to attack from afar or get up close. 

Personally, he is frustrating as hell to fight. He jumps in, does his bursty combo, and jumps away before you can retaliate. Additionally, he doesn't fall off as much as people say. I _really hate lucian_, so I'm probably biased.
